issue.title: fix(validation): also check `root_validators` when `validate_assignment` is on

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
## Change Summary
This is a proposal but I agree with @caldwellshane that `root_validator` should be considered as a regular validator. It should hence be triggered when `validate_assignment` is on.
This is not the case at the moment

## Related issue number

closes #1971

issue.title: validate_assignment with side effect validators

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
# Bug

Output of `python -c "import pydantic.utils; print(pydantic.utils.version_info())"`:
```
             pydantic version: 1.7.2
            pydantic compiled: True
                 install path: /home/arthur/Documents/odmantic/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pydantic
               python version: 3.8.1 (default, Jan  5 2020, 23:12:00)  [GCC 7.3.0]
                     platform: Linux-4.17.14-041714-generic-x86_64-with-glibc2.27
     optional deps. installed: ['typing-extensions']
```

```py
from pydantic import root_validator, BaseModel

class Rectangle(BaseModel):
    width: float
    height: float
    area: float = None

    class Config:
        validate_assignment = True

    @root_validator()
    def set_ts_now(cls, v):
        v["area"] = v["width"] * v["height"]
        return v

r = Rectangle(width=1, height=1)
assert r.area == 1
r.height = 5
assert r.area == 5 # AssertionError, r.area has not been modified
```
I don't know if it should be allowed to use validators this way or if it's a real bug.
I'd be happy to try to implement a fix :smile:

issue.title: Attribute disappear from model instance after assignment validation

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
### Checks

* [x] I added a descriptive title to this issue
* [x] I have searched (google, github) for similar issues and couldn't find anything
* [x] I have read and followed [the docs](https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/) and still think this is a bug

# Bug

Output of `python -c "import pydantic.utils; print(pydantic.utils.version_info())"`:

```
             pydantic version: 1.7.3
            pydantic compiled: True
                 install path: /home/user/project/.venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pydantic
               python version: 3.7.9 (default, Aug 18 2020, 02:07:21)  [GCC 9.3.0]
                     platform: Linux-5.5.15-050515-generic-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-20.04-focal
     optional deps. installed: ['typing-extensions']
```

<details>
<summary>description</summary>

I use pydantic as mapper for MongoDB documents. The data in db is dirty and sometimes contains `null` values in fields where it's not supposed to be. To prevent validation errors and use defaults for such values I've defined root_validator to get rid of `null`s and it've been working fine until update.
</details>

Here is minimal example illustrated the problem. Probably it's related to changes in #2116

```py
from typing import Optional

import pydantic
import pytest


class A(pydantic.BaseModel):
    a: Optional[dict] = None
    b: int = 1

    class Config:
        validate_assignment = True

    @pydantic.root_validator(pre=True)
    def omit_empty(cls, values):
        """remove None values from raw data before instance creation"""
        return {k: v for k, v in values.items() if v is not None}


def test_disappearing():
    a = A()
    assert a.a is None  # OK
    a.b = 2
    with pytest.raises(AttributeError) as e:
        # I would never expect for attribute just disappear but it does
        assert a.a is None
    assert "'A' object has no attribute 'a'" in str(e)
```
